"**Our House** " is a song by [English](/wiki/England "England")
[ska](/wiki/Ska "Ska") and [pop](/wiki/Pop_music "Pop music") band
[Madness](/wiki/Madness_\(band\) "Madness \(band\)"). It was released as the
lead single from their fourth studio album, _[The Rise&
Fall](/wiki/The_Rise_%26_Fall_\(album\) "The Rise & Fall \(album\)")_, on 12
November 1982. The song charted within the top ten in multiple countries and
won Best Pop Song at the May 1983 [Ivor Novello
Awards](/wiki/Ivor_Novello_Awards "Ivor Novello Awards").[3]

##
About[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Our_House_\(Madness_song\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: About")]

Released in November 1982, it peaked at #5 in the [UK singles
chart](/wiki/UK_singles_chart "UK singles chart").[4] In 1983, "Our House" was
their biggest hit in the US, reaching #7 on the [_Billboard_ Hot
100](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot 100").[5] On the US rock chart the
song peaked at #9, and also reached #21 on the US dance chart.[6] It receives
constant airplay by radio stations.

The B-side, "Walking With Mr. Wheeze", is an instrumental song. The title is a
play on "Groovin' With Mr. Bloe", an instrumental hit of 1970 by the session
group [Mr. Bloe](/wiki/Mr._Bloe "Mr. Bloe").[7] In 1984, Madness performed
_Our House_ on the episode "[Sick](/wiki/Sick_\(The_Young_Ones\) "Sick \(The
Young Ones\)")" of _[The Young Ones](/wiki/The_Young_Ones_\(TV_series\) "The
Young Ones \(TV series\)")_.[8]

## Music
video[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Our_House_\(Madness_song\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Music video")]

The video depicts the band acting out the song's lyrics in an old
[Victorian](/wiki/Victorian_architecture "Victorian architecture") [terraced
house](/wiki/Terraced_house "Terraced house"). The song's lyrics mostly
describe the working-class family lifestyle, and the band acts them out by
portraying such a family in the video. The band plays their instruments in the
living room, prepares for work and school as the family plays squash and
relaxes in a hot tub. The video also includes exterior shots of various other
houses including the "Playboy Mansion" [Stocks House](/wiki/Stocks_House
"Stocks House") in [Aldbury](/wiki/Aldbury "Aldbury"), Hertfordshire,[9] and
[Buckingham Palace](/wiki/Buckingham_Palace "Buckingham Palace"). The property
that featured in the video is a terrace house on Stephenson Street in north
west London, near [Willesden Junction](/wiki/Willesden_Junction "Willesden
Junction").[10]

## Use in
media[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Our_House_\(Madness_song\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Use in media")]

In 1982, Madness made a guest appearance in series 2 of _[The Young
Ones](/wiki/The_Young_Ones_\(TV_series\) "The Young Ones \(TV series\)")_
performing "Our House". They had previously appeared in series 1 performing
"[House of Fun](/wiki/House_of_Fun "House of Fun")".

In 1985 "Our House" was the theme song for a children's drama series,
_[Dodger, Bonzo and the Rest](/wiki/Dodger,_Bonzo_and_the_Rest "Dodger, Bonzo
and the Rest")_.[11] The version featured on the show was performed by the
cast members.

A 1992 episode of _[Spitting Image](/wiki/Spitting_Image "Spitting Image")_
featured a satirical version of the song highlighting the [negative
equity](/wiki/Negative_equity "Negative equity") crisis being faced by many
British homeowners at the time.

The original recording was also used as the theme for a 1998
[ITV](/wiki/ITV_\(TV_channel\) "ITV \(TV channel\)") [docusoap](/wiki/Docusoap
"Docusoap") series, _The Estate Agents_.

A [musical](/wiki/Musical_theatre "Musical theatre") called _[Our
House](/wiki/Our_House_\(musical\) "Our House \(musical\)")_ , featuring
Madness songs, ran in [London](/wiki/London "London")'s [West
End](/wiki/West_End_theatre "West End theatre") between October 2002 and
August 2003.[12] A recording of the show was broadcast on [BBC
Three](/wiki/BBC_Three "BBC Three") and was released as a DVD.[13]

An altered version of the song was used in a [Maxwell
House](/wiki/Maxwell_House "Maxwell House") commercial and the real version
was featured in a montage for an episode of the [BBC](/wiki/BBC "BBC") comedy,
_[My Family](/wiki/My_Family "My Family")_ ,[14] as well as for a 2004
American reality game, _House of Dreams_.

The song also featured in a 2007-08 series of TV advertisements for [Bird's
Eye](/wiki/Bird%27s_Eye "Bird's Eye") in which Suggs appeared,[15] as well as
an advertisement for the 2008 ABC reality game show _Opportunity Knocks_ , and
in episode 4 of season 3 of US TV show _[Brothers&
Sisters](/wiki/Brothers_%26_Sisters_\(2006_TV_series\) "Brothers & Sisters
\(2006 TV series\)")_, during the yard sale scene.

In [2010](/wiki/2010_in_television "2010 in television"), a
[mashup](/wiki/Mashup_\(music\) "Mashup \(music\)") of "[Jingle
Bells](/wiki/Jingle_Bells "Jingle Bells")" and "Our House", created by New
York music and audio branding company Expansion Team, was used in a
[Christmastime](/wiki/Christmas "Christmas") commercial for
[Verizon](/wiki/Verizon "Verizon").[16]

At the 2012 Olympic Games Madness performed "Our House" in the closing Olympic
ceremonies during an elaborate light show with scores of dancers.[17]

An altered version of the song is used in a 2014 TV advertisement for Chemist
Warehouse.[18]

In Chile, the song was used in the spot and theme song of Chilean [Canal
13](/wiki/Canal_13_\(Chile\) "Canal 13 \(Chile\)") TV series _Papá Mono_.[19]
